intro: Pigea calycina, commonly known as the scarlet pigeonwings, is a striking flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red, velvety flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Pigea calycina thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions.
